item.title: Report E-2025010293
item.description:
Report E-2025010293

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding an industrial battery that fell over during the off-loading process leaking battery acid. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 20-gallon release onto the wooden dock floor in a 6’ x 8.5’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 53’ x 10’ area. The contractor applied oil dry to the release and up-righted the dropped battery. The impacted absorbents, pallet pieces, and nylon cable were containerized into two 55-gallon DF’s for waste disposal. The battery was cleaned and re-palletized to ship onto the Consignee. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report I-2025010073
item.description:
Report I-2025010073

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CARDINAL HEALTH 414, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: While driving eastbound(speed unknown) on Highway 74 at approximately 6:00 AM on 12/16/2024, the vehicle hit a cow that was in the middle of the road. The driver reported heavy fog at the time of the collision. As a result of the collision, the vehicle left the roadway onto the eastbound shoulder of the road and burst into flames. The driver escaped the vehicle and called emergency medical services. h Upon theif arrival on the scene shortly after the accident, law enforcement closed the eastbound lane of the road. This lane of the road remained closed for several hours until being reopened following decontamination of the area in the evening on December 16. After the vehicle caught fire, the flames consumed the vehicle, 6reaching the shipping container and several of the unit dose shields and spreading some radioactive contamination in the general vicinity of the vehicle. EMS worked to extinguish the fire and in doing so, spread some contamination further around the area, reaching approximately 15-20 feet away from the vehicle. Two of the unit dose pigs were later identified in the debris, while another two items that may have been unit dose pigs were also identified. The other pigs appear to have fully melted in the fire and their materials released. It was not possible to identify which specific doses' pigs were intact. Cleanup was conducted by a contractor, Alpha-Omega Training& Compliance, Inc., with direction by Cardinal Health and a representative from the Georgia DNR Radioactive Materials Program. The area was found to be at background levels after cleanup concluded on the evening of 12/16.

item.title: Report I-2025010053
item.description:
Report I-2025010053

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-02
  • City: Atlanta
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Delta's DG Management Group was notified on 12/03/2024 of a vape pen overheat event that occurred on 12/02/2024 during during the taxi out phase of flight(DL1011, ATL-BDL). A passenger's vape pen overheated and burning/smoke was observed. The flight attendant used a fire containment bag to extinguish the flame. No injuries were reported. The NRC and FAA were notified.
